did.abstract: Postcard views of Michigan cities and the University of Michigan.

acqinfo.p: Brought together from a large number of donors.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright to individual postcards may be held by the producing company.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Postcard Collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The collection has been assembled by the Michigan Historical Collections division of the Bentley Historical Library from a number of individual donors.

scopecontent.p: The Michigan Historical Collections postcard collection contains picture postcards of Michigan scenes. The collection was brought together by MHC staff. The postcards depict a large number of Michigan communities, with the largest number of cards relating to Ann Arbor, the University of Michigan, and Detroit.

The postcards are arranged by the name of the town shown in the picture. In cases where names have changed, or for rural places that might be identified with several surrounding towns, the postcards are filed according to the name used on the card. For instance, postcards of the Irish Hills region can be found under that name as well as under the nearby towns of Brooklyn and Onsted.
Outsize postcards are located in Box 12, and a few postcards too large for that box are located with the medium sized photographs in UCCm.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The library also holds the Penrod/Hiawatha Company postcard collection (1950s-ongoing), which has a separate finding aid. Selected Ann Arbor postcards are available on at the Making of Ann Arbor website: http://moaa.aadl.org/postcards.php.
